column3: Can't do the `configure.ac` changes alone or before the CI changes: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20182#issuecomment-713429491

> Can't do the `configure.ac` changes alone or before the CI changes: [#20182 (comment)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20182#issuecomment-713429491)\n\nCI fails without adding `--enable-suppress-external-warnings`. Or did I understand you wrong?

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #21051 (Fix -Wmismatched-tags warnings by hebasto)
* #20586 (Fix Windows build with --enable-werror by hebasto)

If you
Concept ACK: this redundancy is annoying :)

Rebased 5823be9c88df141d2c876447c1bbab9bfdc260c0 -> 2ed0a09baeac4f99460879e3d68741e3eeb69951 ([pr20544.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr20544.02) -> [pr20544.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr20544.03)) due to the conflict with #20182.

### Guix builds | File | commit f35e4d906fee907f28ac5d8f32d4948e6b7b14c3
(master) | commit bab61ba28f80391a76efdc30ab97822eb99b010c
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | *-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz | [`102cff8d52a60f94...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/f35e4d906fee907f28ac5d8f32d4948e6b7b14c3/bitcoin-f35e4d906fee-aarch64-linux

> `--enable-werror` would now seemingly be unusable in more scenarios (without `--enable-suppress-external-warnings`)

While that is true, strictly speaking, there is also another side to it: `--enable-werror` would now catch problems in more scenarios (i.e. scenarios where a warning is added to the code which is not covered by the existent `-Werror=foo -Werror=bar`).

üêô This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>
off-topic: why is `"x$var" != "x"` used all over the place instead of `-n "$var"`? Or why not just `"$CXXFLAGS_overridden" = "no"`?

> in Clang (where it is enabled by -Wall) before 5.0\n\nDon't we only support [Clang 5.0+](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/dependencies.md#dependencies) now? Why do we need to work around something that happens with Clang < 5.0?

If this is only relevant when compiling for darwin, can't we scope it as such? Otherwise you are turning off this warning to accommodate what is essentially a quirk of our depends system, which only happens when cross-compiling for a single target.
Sorry for a typo. Should be "prior to 6.0". Going to fix it.
